domains.label: Spiking Neural Networks
domains.description: Bio-inspired neural computation using temporal spike patterns. Exploring energy-efficient learning algorithms and neuromorphic hardware implementations.

domains.label: World Models & Embodied Learning
domains.description: Learning predictive models of environment dynamics through embodied interaction. Focus on few-shot adaptation and transfer learning.

domains.label: Reasoning & Meta-Learning
domains.description: Developing systems that learn how to learn. Research into compositional reasoning and systematic generalization.

domains.label: Consciousness & AI Ethics
domains.description: Exploring computational models of consciousness and their ethical implications. Research into self-awareness and moral reasoning in AI systems.
insights: Consciousness may emerge from information integration
Ethics must be built into AI from the ground up

experiments.title: Spiking Neural Network Pattern Recognition
experiments.abstract: Developed a bio-inspired SNN architecture for real-time pattern recognition with 90% accuracy and 10x energy efficiency compared to traditional ANNs. Uses temporal spike encoding for feature extraction.
experiments.findings: Temporal coding significantly improves energy efficiency while maintaining accuracy

experiments.title: World Model for Embodied Agent Navigation
experiments.abstract: Implemented predictive world models enabling sample-efficient navigation in complex environments. Agent learns environment dynamics through embodied interaction and generalizes to unseen scenarios.
experiments.findings: Embodied learning reduces sample complexity by 5x compared to model-free approaches

experiments.title: Meta-Learning for Few-Shot Reasoning Tasks
experiments.abstract: Developed a meta-learning framework that enables rapid adaptation to new reasoning tasks with minimal examples. Combines gradient-based meta-learning with compositional representations.
experiments.findings: Compositional meta-learning achieves human-level performance on novel reasoning tasks

experiments.title: Consciousness Measurement Framework
experiments.abstract: Developed computational metrics for measuring consciousness-like properties in AI systems based on Integrated Information Theory and Global Workspace Theory.
experiments.findings: Integrated information correlates with emergent self-awareness behaviors

experiments.title: Compression with Self-Organizing Maps
experiments.abstract: Novel approach using SOMs to reduce high-dimensional sensory input while preserving semantic structure. Enables efficient online learning in resource-constrained environments.
experiments.findings: SOM-based compression maintains 95% semantic fidelity at 50x compression ratio

experiments.title: Ethical Reasoning in Autonomous Systems
experiments.abstract: Framework for embedding ethical reasoning capabilities into autonomous systems using deontic logic and value alignment techniques.
experiments.findings: Deontic logic enables consistent ethical decision-making under uncertainty
experiments.dataset: Moral Machine dataset, Custom ethical dilemmas

researchFindings.title: Spiking Neural Networks
researchFindings.description: Temporal spike encoding achieves 10x energy efficiency while maintaining 90% accuracy on pattern recognition tasks.

researchFindings.title: World Models
researchFindings.description: Embodied learning reduces sample complexity by 5x compared to model-free approaches in navigation tasks.

researchFindings.title: Meta-Learning
researchFindings.description: Compositional meta-learning achieves 92% accuracy on novel reasoning tasks.

researchFindings.title: Consciousness Metrics
researchFindings.description: Integrated Information Theory correlates with emergent self-awareness behaviors.
